Posts.Content: Mar 21, 2009 09:42PM mollymack wrote: Hi Peggy, I had an almost identical reaction to Taxotere, also on my 2nd treatment.  I am now going to do A/C, and I'm curious....did you start from scratch and do 4 A/C's or just 3?  What did your onc advise? Thanks, Molly
Posts.Title: Anyone else allergic to taxotere? peggyc CrystalLocket

Posts.Content: Apr 20, 2009 07:49AM mollymack wrote: Hi Gina, My insurance wouldn't cover Abraxane, so I am finishing up with 3 rounds af adriamycin.  Good luck to you. Molly
Posts.Title: Anyone else allergic to taxotere? peggyc CrystalLocket

Posts.Content: Apr 20, 2009 07:47AM mollymack wrote: Hi Peggy, Thanks for getting back to me, sorry for my delayed response.  I, too, have decided just to do the 3 A/C treatments, in addition to the one T/C that I had with no allergic reaction.  My parameters (i.e. tumor size, grade, Oncotype, nodes, etc) are pretty much identical to yours, and my onc felt the same as yours did about doing the 3 as opposed to the 4 A/C.   The A/C has not been a walk in the park, but I have one more to go and then I'm done!  Take good care. Molly
Posts.Title: Anyone else allergic to taxotere? peggyc CrystalLocket

Posts.Content: Feb 15, 2009 03:49AM mollymack wrote: Yes, I live in Fairfield County and saw Gina Chung at Yale in January for an opinion.  She's very bright and I highly recommend her.  Others with great reputations include Lindsay Harris, Kenneth Miller, and Michael DiGiovana.  I am an M.D. myself, so all of the aforementioned came highly recommended from colleagues.  I'm not following up there though, as it's logistically too difficult and I'm staying local for my treatment.  Hope that helps!
